entry.title: opening of the first bud of a horse chestnut tree in Geneva
entry.content: ... that the opening of the first bud of a horse chestnut tree in Geneva (pictured), as recorded by the secretary of the Parliament, announces the beginning of spring?

entry.title: distaste for uncertainty
entry.content: ... that people are prone to such a strong distaste for uncertainty that they might value a $50 gift card more than a lottery ticket that yields a $50 or $100 gift card with equal probability?

entry.title: twenty-one generals are recognised as having died for France
entry.content: ... that although the First World War ended with the armistice of 11 November 1918, twenty-one generals are recognised as having died for France after this date, some as late as 1923?

entry.title: Concentricities
entry.content: ... that Concentricities, a 2019 clarinet–cello–piano trio by Graham Waterhouse, musically depicts a theme of circular, spiraling, or oscillating concentric phenomena in nature and human structures?

entry.title: Wan Abubakar
entry.content: ... that Wan Abubakar submitted his resignation to run for reelection, but retracted it when his candidacy failed?

entry.title: 2022 Armed Forces Bowl
entry.content: ... that a kickoff temperature of 13 °F (−11 °C) at the 2022 Armed Forces Bowl nearly made it the coldest bowl game ever?

entry.title: Mi Shebeirach
entry.content: ... that Debbie Friedman and Drorah Setel's Mi Shebeirach for healing, written by the couple amidst the AIDS crisis, has become "the emotional highlight of synagogue services" for many Jews?

entry.title: Elmer Carlson
entry.content: ... that American Elmer Carlson brought a roller-skating mule to the 1964 Democratic National Convention?
